conclusion: The objects are casting shadows (A, B, C, and D) on the ground.
The light source is initially positioned, casting shadows in specific directions.
The light source moves to the front right, away from the objects.
As the light source moves to the front right, the shadows will shift to the left and backward (toward the back of the scene).
The size of the shadows will depend on the height of the objects and the angle of the light.
Moving the light source away increases the shadow length if the light is lower, but if the light is higher, the shadows might become shorter due to a steeper angle.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the left and backward.
The size of the shadows may increase or decrease depending on the height of the light source relative to the objects.
